sen.j: 飛鳥京跡（あすかきょうあと）は奈良県高市郡明日香村岡にある飛鳥時代の遺跡。
sen.e: The Asuka Capital site, located in Oka, Asuka village, Takaichi county, Nara Prefecture, is an Asuka-era archaeological site.
The Asuka Capital site, located in Oka, Asuka Village, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture, is an Asuka-era archaeological site.
The Asuka Capital site, located in Oka, Asuka Village, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture, is an Asuka-period archaeological site.

sen.j: 7世紀の宮殿の遺構だとされる。
sen.e: It is considered to be the site of a palace built in the seventh century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It's considered to be the site of a palace built in the seventh century.
It's considered to be the site of a palace built in the seventh century.

sen.j: 日本書紀などに記述される飛鳥におかれた天皇（大王 (ヤマト王権)）の宮の跡地であると考えられている。
sen.e: The site is thought to be the palace of the emperors (the kings [of the Yamato sovereign]) which was built in the Asuka area where was noted in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The site is thought to be the palace of the emperors (the kings [of the Yamato sovereign]) that was built in the Asuka area noted in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), etc.
The site is thought to be the palace of the emperors (the kings [of the Yamato sovereign]) that was built in the Asuka area noted in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), etc.

sen.j: もともとこの区域には宮らしき遺跡があることは言われている。
sen.e: It has been said that in this area there's an archaeological site what appears to be a place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has been said that in this area there is an archaeological site that appears to be a palace.
It has been said that in this area there is an archaeological site that appears to be a palace.

sen.j: 伝承により板蓋宮の跡だとされてきた。
sen.e: It was handed down as the site of Itabuki no Miya Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was handed down as the site of Itabuki no Miya Palace.
It was handed down as the site of Itabuki no Miya Palace.

sen.j: 初期の発掘調査で見つかった遺構についても国の指定史跡として伝飛鳥板蓋宮跡（でんあすかいたぶきみやあと）として登録されている。
sen.e: The remains discovered during the initial archaeological survey was designated as a national historical site and registered as Den Asuka Itabuki Miya Ato (the site of Den Asuka Itabuki Miya).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The remains discovered during the initial archaeological survey were designated as a national historical site and registered as Den Asuka Itabuki Miya Ato (the site of Den Asuka Itabuki Miya).
The remains discovered during the initial archaeological survey were designated as a national historical site and registered as Den Asuka Itabuki Miya Ato (the legendary site of Asuka Itabuki Miya).
sen.cmt: 「伝」は「伝承による」と言う意味だと思いますので、説明を変更しました。

sen.j: この名称で参照されることも多い。
sen.e: This name is often used for reference.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This name is often used for reference.
This name is often used for reference.

sen.j: 昭和34年から発掘調査が始まった。
sen.e: The archaeological survey started in 1959.
The archaeological survey started in 1959.
The archaeological survey started in 1959.

sen.j: 発掘調査が進んでいる区域では、時期の異なる遺構が重なって存在することがわかっている。
sen.e: In the area where archaeological research has progressed, it has been discovered that the remains of different ages were found in the sequence of archaeological layers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: In the area where archaeological research has progressed, it has been discovered that the remains of different ages were found in the sequence of archaeological layers.
In the area where archaeological research has progressed, it has been discovered that the remains of different ages were found in the sequence of archaeological layers.

sen.j: おおまかにはⅠ期、Ⅱ期、Ⅲ期遺構と3つに分類される。
sen.e: The remains of different ages can be roughly divided into three periods: The remains of the first period, the second period, and the third period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The remains from different ages can be roughly divided into the first, second and third periods.
The remains from different ages can be roughly divided into the first, second and third periods.

sen.j: 各期の時代順序と、日本書紀などの文献史料の記述を照らし合わせた。
sen.e: The time order of three periods was checked by looking up the description written in the historical materials such as Nihonshoki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: The time order of the three periods was checked by looking up the description written in historical materials such as Nihonshoki.
The time order of the three periods was checked by looking up the description written in historical materials such as Nihonshoki.

sen.j: それぞれ、 Ⅰ期が岡本宮（630～636年）、 Ⅱ期が板蓋宮（643～645年、655年）、 Ⅲ期が岡本宮（656～660年）、飛鳥浄御原宮（672～694年）、の遺構であると考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that the remains of three periods are as follows: The first period: Okamoto no Miya Palace (630-636); The second period: Itabuki no Miya Palace (643-645 or 655); and The Third Period: Okamoto no Miya (656-660) and Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Palace (672-694).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is thought that the remains of thethree periods are as follows: first period, Okamoto no Miya Palace (630 - 636); second period, Itabuki no Miya Palace (643 - 645 or 655); and third period, Okamoto no Miya (656 - 660) and Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Palace (672 - 694).

It is thought that the remains of the three periods are as follows: first period, Okamoto no Miya Palace (630 - 636); second period, Itabuki no Miya Palace (643 - 645 or 655); and third period, Okamoto no Miya (656 - 660) and Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Palace (672 - 694).

sen.j: Ⅲ期の後飛鳥岡本宮・飛鳥浄御原宮については出土した遺物の年代考察からかなり有力視されている。
sen.e: Judging from the result after examining the age of the artifacts which were excavated from the site, it is highly probable that the remains of the third period were Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya Palace and Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Judging from the result of examining the age of the artifacts that have been excavated from the site, it is very probable that the remains of the third period were Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya Palace and Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.

Judging from the result of examining the age of the artifacts that have been excavated from the site, it is very probable that the remains of the third period were Nochino Asuka no Okamoto no Miya Palace and Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: 最上段の層の遺構は内郭と外郭からなっている。
sen.e: The remains of the top layer consists of naikaku (inner defensive enclosure) area and gaikaku (outer defensive enclosure) area.
The remains of the top layer consist of a naikaku (inner defensive enclosure) area and a gaikaku (outer defensive enclosure) area.
The remains of the top layer consist of a naikaku (inner defensive enclosure) area and a gaikaku (outer defensive enclosure) area.

sen.j: 内郭は東西158メートル、南北197メートルである。
sen.e: The naikaku area measures 158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from south to north.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The naikaku area measures 158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from south to north.
The naikaku area measures 158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from south to north.

sen.j: 南北の二区画に分かれている。
sen.e: It is separated into two areas of north and south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is separated into the two areas of north and south.
It is separated into the two areas of north and south.

sen.j: 北区画の方が広く、一辺約151メートルの正方形である。
sen.e: The north area is larger than the south area and the shape of the north area is a square, measuring approximately 151 meters on a side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: The north area, which is square, is larger than the south area, measuring approximately 151 meters on a side.
The north area, which is square, is larger than the south area, measuring approximately 151 meters on a side.

sen.j: 井戸、高床建物、廊状建物の建物が多く、川原石が敷かれている。
sen.e: In the north area, some wells, raised-floor constructions, and covered corridors are commonly found and the river stones are laid out.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: In the north area, some wells, raised-floor constructions and covered corridors are commonly found, and river stones are laid out.
In the north area, some wells, raised-floor constructions and covered corridors are commonly found, and river stones are laid out.

sen.j: 南区画の方は20×11.2メートルの大規模な建物跡が確認されている。
sen.e: In the south area, a large building site with the size of 20 by 11.2 meters were found.
In the south area, a large building site measuring 20 meters by 11.2 meters has been found.
In the south area, a large building site measuring 20 meters by 11.2 meters has been found.

sen.j: この建物の中心線と内郭の中心線とが一致している。
sen.e: The center line of the building corresponds with the center line of the naikaku area.
The centerline of the building corresponds to that of the naikaku area.
The centerline of the building corresponds to that of the naikaku area.

sen.j: 周りに小砂利が敷かれている。
sen.e: The pebbles are spread around the building.
The pebbles are spread around the building.
The pebbles are spread around the building.

sen.j: 少し離れた所に南門が建設されている。
sen.e: The south gate stood a little distance away from the building.
The south gate stood a short distance away from the building.
The south gate stood a short distance away from the building.

sen.j: 外郭でも掘立柱建物・塀・石組溝等が検出されている。
sen.e: In the gaikaku area, some moats, stone-paved ditches, and pits of "hottate-bashira" (the columns which were embedded directly in the ground to build a construction like a raised-floor construction) were found.
sen.cmt: ※飛鳥京遺跡の写真や記事をウェブで確認したところ、掘立柱建物（柱跡からその存在が確認されている）自体が遺構として残っているわけではなく、柱跡のピットが写っていたため左のように訳しました。
sen.e: In the gaikaku area, some moats, stone-paved ditches and pits of "hottate-bashira" (columns embedded directly in the ground for construction, such as in a raised-floor construction) have been found.
In the gaikaku area, some moats, stone-paved ditches and pits of "hottate-bashira" (columns embedded directly in the ground for construction, such as in a raised-floor construction) have been found.

sen.j: これらの内郭・外郭ともに太い掘立柱を立てた塀で囲まれている。
sen.e: Both the naikaku and the gaikaku are surrounded by the moats where the thick hottate-bashira columns were erected.
Both the naikaku and gaikaku are surrounded by moats in which the thick hottate-bashira columns were erected.
Both the naikaku and gaikaku are surrounded by moats in which the thick hottate-bashira columns were erected.

sen.j: この他に、「エビノコ郭」（小字「エビノコ」にあることからこの名にしている）と呼ばれる一画があり、29.2×15.3メートルで四面ひさし付きの大型の掘立建物（エビノコ大殿と名付けられている）が発見されている。
sen.e: Other than the above two areas, there is an area called "Ebinoko-kaku" (Ebinoko enclosure) (which was named because it was located in the subsection of the village called "Ebinoko") where the large hottate building (named as the Ebinoko grand palace) with the size of 29.2 by 15.3 meters and the canopies on four sides were discovered.

Other than the above two areas, there is an area called "Ebinoko-kaku" (Ebinoko enclosure) (so named because it was located in the subsection of the village called "Ebinoko"), where the large hottate building (called the Ebinoko grand palace) measuring 29.2 meters by 15.3 meters and the canopies on four sides were discovered.

Other than the above two areas, there is an area called 'Ebinoko-kaku' (Ebinoko enclosure) (so named because it was located in the subsection of the village called 'Ebinoko'), where the large hottate building (called the Ebinoko grand palace) measuring 29.2 meters by 15.3 meters and the canopies on four sides were discovered.

sen.j: その周辺を南北100メートル以上、東西約100メートルの掘立柱の塀で囲まれている。
sen.e: The building is surrounded by the moat, its length is about 100 meters from north to south and more than 100 meters from east to west, where the hottate-bashira columns were erected.
The building is surrounded by the moat, and its length is approximately 100 meters from north to south and more than 100 meters from east to west, where the hottate-bashira columns were erected.
The building is surrounded by the moat, and its length is more than 100 meters from north to south and approximately 100 meters from east to west, where the hottate-bashira columns were erected.
sen.cmt: 「以上」と「約」が逆になっていたので訂正しました。

sen.j: 外郭の外側から「辛巳年」（かのとみ）「大津皇子」「大来」等と書かれた墨書木簡が発見されている。
sen.e: Some Bokusho-mokkan (a narrow wooden strip on which some words are written in black ink called "sumi") on which some Chinese characters are written, such as "Kanotomi" (辛巳年), "Otsu-no-miko" (大津皇子 ［Prince Otsu]), and "Okume" (大来), were discovered in the outside area of the gaikaku.
sen.cmt: 文字自体が問題にされているため、英訳内に漢字を残しました。
sen.e: Some Bokusho-mokkan (a narrow wooden strip on which some words are written in black ink called "sumi") on which some Chinese characters are written, such as "Kanotomi" (辛巳年)," "Otsu-no-miko" (大津皇子 ［Prince Otsu]) and "Okume" (大来), were discovered in the outer area of the gaikaku.

Some Bokusho-mokkan (a narrow wooden strip on which some words are written in black ink called 'sumi') on which some Chinese characters are written, such as 'Kanotomi' (辛巳年),' 'Otsu-no-miko' (大津皇子 ［Prince Otsu]) and 'Okume' (大来), were discovered in the outer area of the gaikaku.

sen.j: 「辛巳年」は天武10年(681)、「大来」は大友皇子の姉の大来（伯）皇女の名と推定できる。
sen.e: It can be estimated that those characters refer to the followings: "Kanotomi" means Tenmu 10th years (681) and "Okume" means the name of Prince Otomo's sister, Okume-no-miko (Princess Okume).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can be estimated that those characters refer to the following: "Kanotomi" means Tenmu 10th year (681), and "Okume" means the name of Prince Otomo's sister, Okume-no-miko (Princess Okume).
It can be estimated that those characters refer to the following: 'Kanotomi' means Tenmu 10th year (681), and 'Okume' means the name of Prince Otomo's sister, Okume-no-miko (Princess Okume).

sen.j: このこと等から、この最上段の層の遺構を宮殿建築と想定すると天武天皇の飛鳥浄御原宮と見なす説が有力である。
sen.e: For this reason, if we assume that the remain of the top layer is the palace building, it is reasonable to consider that widely accepted theory is that the remain is the Emperor Tenmu's Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, if we assume that the remains of the top layer comprise the palace building, it is reasonable to consider that the widely accepted theory is that the remains are the Emperor Tenmu's Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.

Therefore, if we assume that the remains of the top layer comprise the palace building, it is reasonable to consider that the widely accepted theory is that the remains are the Emperor Tenmu's Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: 遺構の全体の範囲はまだわかっておらず、範囲特定のための発掘調査も行なわれている。
sen.e: Because the range of whole remains hasn't been defined yet, the archaeological research to specify the range has been conducted.
Because the overall range of remains hasn't yet been defined, archaeological research by which to specify the range has been conducted.
Because the overall range of remains hasn't yet been defined, archaeological research by which to specify the range has been conducted.

sen.j: 「飛鳥京跡」といえば上記の宮殿遺構を指すことが一般的ではある。
sen.e: Generally, the "Asuka capital site" points out the palace sites mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Generally, the "Asuka capital site" points out the palace sites mentioned above.
Generally, the 'Asuka capital site' points out the palace sites mentioned above.

sen.j: しかし、宮殿遺構の600メートル北の遺跡についても「飛鳥京跡」と指し示される。
sen.e: However, the site located 600 meters north from the palace site is also called as the "Asuka capital site."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the site located 600 meters north of the palace site is also called the "Asuka capital site."
However, the site located 600 meters north of the palace site is also called the 'Asuka capital site.'

sen.j: また、宮殿遺構の北西の庭園跡（飛鳥京跡苑池遺構）についても「飛鳥京跡で見つかった苑池遺構」と紹介されることもある。
sen.e: Sometimes the garden site (Asuka Kyo Ato Enchi iko [the site of a large pond in the garden located in the Asuka capital site]) where is located in northwest of the palace site is introduced as "the garden pond site found in the Asuka capital site."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sometimes the garden site (Asuka Kyo Ato Enchi iko [the site of a large pond in the garden located in the Asuka capital site]), which is located northwest of the palace site, is introduced as "the garden pond site found within the Asuka capital site."

Sometimes the garden site (Asuka Kyo Ato Enchi iko [the site of a large pond in the garden located in the Asuka capital site]), which is located northwest of the palace site, is introduced as 'the garden pond site found within the Asuka capital site.'

sen.j: 「飛鳥京跡」が指し示す対象範囲は人と場合により必ずしも一定ではないようである。
sen.e: It seems that the range of "Asuka capital site" does not always the same for some people and in some cases.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Apparently, the range of "Asuka capital site" isn't always the same for some people and in some cases.
Apparently, the range of 'Asuka capital site' isn't always the same for some people and in some cases.

sen.j: 発掘調査で構造がもっともよく判明しているのは、飛鳥浄御原宮である。
sen.e: It is Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace where the structure has been more clearly proved by the archaeological research.
It is Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace whose structure has been more clearly defined by the archaeological research.
It is Asuka Kiyomihara no Miya Palace whose structure has been more clearly defined by the archaeological research.

sen.j: そこでは天皇の居住空間に相当する区画は東西152～158メートル、南北197メートルである。
sen.e: The area which corresponds to the emperor's residence stretches 152-158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from north to south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The area, which corresponds to the emperor's residence, stretches 152 to 158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from north to south.
The area, which corresponds to the emperor's residence, stretches 152 to 158 meters from east to west and 197 meters from north to south.

sen.j: その南東の儀礼空間は東西94メートル、南北55メートルである。
sen.e: The space for religious services, located in the southeast of the emperor's residence, measures 94 meters from east to west and 55 meters from north to south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The space for religious services, located in the southeast of the emperor's residence, measures 94 meters from east to west and 55 meters from north to south.
The space for religious services, located in the southeast of the emperor's residence, measures 94 meters from east to west and 55 meters from north to south.

sen.j: これらの周囲を役所や庭園などの関連施設が取り囲んでいる。
sen.e: The related facilities, such as government offices and gardens, encircle the space.
The related facilities, such as government offices and gardens, encircle the space.
The related facilities, such as government offices and gardens, encircle the space.

sen.j: さらに役所の一部は周辺地域へも広がっている。
sen.e: Some sites of the government offices are also found in the surrounding areas.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Some sites of the government offices are also found in the surrounding areas.
Some sites of the government offices are also found in the surrounding areas.

sen.j: 板蓋宮は皇極・斉明天皇の2代の天皇、飛鳥浄御原宮は天武・持統天皇の2代の天皇がそれぞれ使用した。
sen.e: The two emperors, the Emperor Kogyoku and the Emperor Saimei, used the Itabuki no Miya Palace and the two successive emperors, the Emperor Tenmu and the Emperor Jito, used the Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Place.
The two emperors, Kogyoku and Saimei, used Itabuki no Miya Palace and the two successive emperors, Tenmu and Jito, used Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Palace.
The two emperors, Kogyoku and Saimei, used Itabuki no Miya Palace and the two successive emperors, Tenmu and Jito, used Asuka Kiyohara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: こうした状況は、当時の宮は、天皇一代限りの行宮という考え方ではなく、何代もの天皇の宮として使用されるものとの考え方に変わってきていることが分かる。
sen.e: This fact tells that people had an idea that a palace at the time should have been used by many emperors rather than used as an angu (the palace where the emperor lived temporarily) for one emperor.
This indicates that people of the time felt that a palace should be used by many emperors rather than used as an angu (the palace where the emperor lived temporarily) for one emperor.
This indicates that people of the time felt that a palace should be used by many emperors rather than used as an angu (the palace where the emperor lived temporarily) for one emperor.

sen.j: つまり、飛鳥宮は、移りゆく宮から固定した都へと変化する転換点であった。
sen.e: The Asuka no Miya Palace represents the turning point of a form of a capital that was changing from a capital which moves everytime a new emperor changes his palace to a capital which is established in one place.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: The Asuka no Miya Palace represents the turning point of a form of capital that was changing from one that would be moved each time a new emperor changes his palace to a capital that was established in one place.

The Asuka no Miya Palace represented the turning point of a form of capital that was changing from one that would be moved each time a new emperor changed his palace to a capital that was established in one place.
